# Country Analysis

This analysis tracks changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country over time.

```{python}
#| echo: true
import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.express as px

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder = px.data.gapminder()

# Specify the country to analyze
country_name = 'India'

# Filter data for the selected country
country_data = gapminder[gapminder['country'] == country_name]

# Create the line plots
fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=country_data['year'],
    y=country_data['lifeExp'],
    mode='lines+markers',
    name='Life Expectancy',
    line=dict(color='blue')
))

fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=country_data['year'],
    y=country_data['gdpPercap'],
    mode='lines+markers',
    name='GDP per Capita',
    yaxis='y2',
    line=dict(color='green')
))

fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(
    x=country_data['year'],
    y=country_data['pop'],
    mode='lines+markers',
    name='Population',
    yaxis='y3',
    line=dict(color='red')
))

# Create axis objects
fig.update_layout(
    title=f'Trends Over Time for {country_name}',
    xaxis=dict(title='Year'),
    yaxis=dict(title='Life Expectancy', titlefont=dict(color='blue'), tickfont=dict(color='blue')),
    yaxis2=dict(
        title='GDP per Capita',
        titlefont=dict(color='green'),
        tickfont=dict(color='green'),
        anchor='x',
        overlaying='y',
        side='right'
    ),
    yaxis3=dict(
        title='Population',
        titlefont=dict(color='red'),
        tickfont=dict(color='red'),
        anchor='free',
        overlaying='y',
        side='left',
        position=0.05
    ),
    legend=dict(x=0.1, y=1.1, orientation='h')
)

fig.show()
